solution_line_template: First find how many minutes Jenna tans each of the first two weeks: {tan_minutes_per_day} minutes/day * {tan_days_per_week} days/week = <<{tan_minutes_per_day}*{tan_days_per_week}={minutes_tanned_per_week}>>{minutes_tanned_per_week} minutes/week

Then multiply that number by the number of weeks to find how many minutes Jenna tans in the first half of the month: {minutes_tanned_per_week} minutes/week * {initial_weeks_tanning} weeks = <<{minutes_tanned_per_week}*{initial_weeks_tanning}={minutes_tanned_first_half_month}>>{minutes_tanned_first_half_month} minutes

Then subtract that time from the total time Jenna can spend tanning to find how many more minutes she can tan: {max_tan_minutes_per_month} minutes - {minutes_tanned_first_half_month} minutes = <<{max_tan_minutes_per_month}-{minutes_tanned_first_half_month}={remaining_tan_minutes}>>{remaining_tan_minutes} minutes
